Title: Digital Twin and Human Factors in Manufacturing and Logistics Systems: State of the Art and Future Research Directions
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the current state and future research directions of digital twins in integrating human factors in manufacturing and logistics systems, but does not specifically address the energy sector.

Title: Human Trust and Digital Twins in a Human Factors and Ergonomic Framework
Authors: L. Pietrantoni, Mabel San Román-Niaves, M. Angelis
Venue: IEEE International Conference on Emerging Technologies and Factory Automation
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the importance of integrating human factors principles to enhance the accuracy and functionality of digital twins, fostering trust and collaboration.

Title: A review on digital twins for power generation and distribution
Abstract summary: This paper reviews digital twin applications in the energy sector, but does not specifically address limitations regarding human factors.

Title: XR and digital twins, and their role in human factor studies
Abstract summary: Digital twins combined with XR technology can improve human factors in nuclear asset design and operations.

Title: From Digital Human Modeling to Human Digital Twin: Framework and Perspectives in Human Factors
Authors: Qiqi He, Li Li, Dai Li, Tao Peng, Xiangying Zhang, Yincheng Cai, Xujun Zhang, Renzhong Tang
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the evolution from digital human modeling to human digital twins, and the potential of human digital twins to enhance human factors in industrial applications, but does not specifically address limitations in the energy sector.

Title: A New Concept of Digital Twin Supporting Optimization and Resilience of Factories of the Future
Authors: Adrien Bécue, Eva Maia, Linda Feeken, Philipp Borchers, Isabel Praça
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a holistic Digital Twin approach that integrates human behavior models to address limitations of current asset-specific Digital Twins in the manufacturing context.

Title: A Theoretical Open Architecture Framework and Technology Stack for Digital Twins in Energy Sector Applications
Authors: S. Gourisetti, S. Bhadra, D. Sebastian-Cardenas, Md Touhiduzzaman, Osman Ahmed
Abstract summary: This paper proposes a digital twin open architecture framework and technology stack for the energy sector, but does not address human factors limitations.

Title: Human Digital Twin in Industry 4.0: Concept and Preliminary Model
Authors: Y. Naudet, Alexandre Baudet, Margot Risse
Venue: International Conference on Innovative Intelligent Industrial Production and Logistics
Abstract summary: Digital twins currently lack integration of human elements, which limits their usefulness in systems with both machines and human workers.
